categoryRubrics.rule: Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
Patient DOB should be valid and properly precisioned
Patient's Alternative Name Rule
Patient's Alternative Name Rule
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Allergies Concern observation effective times reflect the appropriate allergy concern status
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
Reaction Observation in the Allergy template is a SHOULD, this Rubic takes it to a SHALL. Preference is to have a Reaction present and Null the value if the reaction is uknown
Author entry must include at least a timestamp with information of the last modified date and be present within the Allergies entry, which could be at the concern or observation level.
categoryRubrics.description: Author entry must include at least a timestamp with information of the last modified date and be present within the Allergies entry, which could be at the concern or observation level.

categoryRubrics.rule: Allergies should be structured in UNII, NDF-RT, SNOMED or RxNorm
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Immunizations coded with CVX codes
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
categoryRubrics.description: All Template Ids should be present with valid extension value

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Medications coded with RxNorm SCD, SBD, GPCK, or BPCPK codes
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
Each medication needs to have its own Medication Signature Text EntryRelationship and the reference should exist in the same section where you found it

<substanceAdministration xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" classCode="SBADM" moodCode="EVN">

categoryRubrics.description: Each medication needs to have its own Medication Signature Text EntryRelationship and the reference should exist in the same section where you found it

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: All problem codes are should express with core subset of SNOMED codes
Problem Concern effective times reflect the appropriate problem concern status
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
The problem observation value should not be set to the problem observation code (problem type value set)

Author entry must include the most recent author with at least a timestamp with information of the last modified date and be present within the Problems entry, which could be at the concern or observation level.
categoryRubrics.description: Author entry must include the most recent author with at least a timestamp with information of the last modified date and be present within the Problems entry, which could be at the concern or observation level.

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Smoking status code value should be valid
Smoking status observation Template Id should be valid
Systems should capture birth sex independent of the Administrative Gender and encode them as an observation in the Social History Section
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
The Vital Sign Observation entries should use LOINC codes to represent the type of vital sign being captured
Each of the Vital Sign Observations should use the recommended UCUM units to represent the vital sign measurement result
The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Vital Sign Organizer must encompass the underlying observations
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value

referenceErrors.description: A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Encounter Diagnosis (V3) 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.80:2015-08-01. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension. See C-CDA R2.1 Volume 1 - Design Considerations for additional detail (CONF:1198-32936, CONF:1198-32934, DSTU:757, DSTU:781).

A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Procedure Activity Procedure2 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.14:2014-06-09. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension. See C-CDA R2.1 Volume 1 - Design Considerations for additional detail (CONF:1198-32936, CONF:1198-32934, DSTU:757, DSTU:781).

The node '@unit' does not exist at the expected path /ClinicalDocument[1]/component[1]/structuredBody[1]/component[10]/section[1]/entry[1]/organizer[1]/component[3]/observation[1]/value[1] but is required as per the specification: If Observation/value is a physical quantity (xsi:type="PQ"), the unit of measure SHALL be selected from ValueSet UnitsOfMeasureCaseSensitive 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12839 DYNAMIC (CONF:1198-31484).
referenceErrors.type: ONC 2015 S&CC Vocabulary Validation Conformance Error
